description.p: Infused with the rawest form of magical energy a little creature running around on a battlefield full of spellcasters. The little creature is collecting tiny glowing marbles which radiant a tiny magical aura from within. Sometimes a marble disappears in a floating book close. Others drop to the ground near some of the fighting people unleashing several bolts or other spells previously casted by them.

A Spellbinder got the never-ending quest to collect all knowledge corresponding to the arcane energies in the whole multiverse. Spellbinder are not born or trained like others; they are evolved into. Spellcasters who want to get the complete enlightenment about their magic and their potential might became a Spellbinder. But more often those seekers end up dead before their transformation. Spellbinder are able to remember their previous life and what they’ve learned but many things they need to relearn like using magic due to their new but deeper connection to it.

When deciding to play a Spellbinder, think about what led your character to do the tasks of a Spellbinder. Maybe collecting arcane knowledge is a tradition in the area, or your character was supposed to be a researcher. What is your relationship with magic and spells in general? Is there a measure of arcane power?
How did your character come to be an adventurer? Maybe you need to travel around to collect all the knowledge spread around the multiverse or you are just hungry for power.

You can make a Spellbinder quickly by following these suggestions. First, Wisdom should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution and Intelligence. Second, select the Noble or Cloistered Scholar background. Third, select the Fire Bolt, Shocking Grasp and Ray of Frost or Light cantrips. Fourth, select the Burning Hands, Thunderwave and Mage Armor spells.
As a Spellbinder, you gain the following class features

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Spellbinder level after 1st
Weapons: Daggers, darts, quarterstaffs, sickles, slings
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, History, Insight, Investigation and Nature

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a quarterstaff, (b) a dagger or (c) a sickle
(a) a sling and 20 sling bullet or (c) 10 darts
(a) a priest’s pack or (b) a scholar’s pack

sheet.description: A collector of spells and knowledge.

setters.set: A collector of spells and knowledge.

description.p: As a being so close to the arcane energies of the world and your intuitive knowledge of the magic itself allows you to cast some spells. A Spellbinder doesn’t learn spells the usual way like a Wizard or Sorcerer. They must use their Binding Book or Spell Binding ability to learn new spells.
You know 3 cantrips of your choice from any spell list. You don’t learn additional Spellbinder cantrips at higher levels as usual.

The Spellbinder table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and above. To cast one of your Spellbinder spells, you must expend a spell slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
description.h5: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
description.p: You know three 1st-level spells of your choice from any spell list. You don’t learn additional Spells on reaching a higher level. You also can’t replace your spells as usual.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Spellbinder spells since you are a collector of arcane knowledge. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spellbinder spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

center.p: Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

description.p: You can cast any Spellbinder spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag. While doing that you don’t expend a spell slot. Out of combat, you also don’t add the 10 minutes to the casting time.
You can’t use any kind focus as a spellcasting focus for your Spellbinder spells except of your Binding Book.

At 1st level, you get to be linked to a spellbook. You need this book to feel complete, without it you slowly become insane. This spellbook contains your memories and everything you acknowledged including every cantrip and spell you learned. If you learn any spells the non-traditional way the spells magically appear in the spellbook. You need to have by your side to cast spells. While casting spells your book floats and some light effects coming from it representing the spell Since you are linked to this book you know every time where it.
You can’t sense your book while you or your book is on a different plane or in a magic isolated zone.
This book is your one and only spellcasting focus and can’t be harmed as long as you live.
You are the only person who can write and read in this book. Every other person need permission from you or can only read cryptic runes shimmering and flowing thru the pages.

description.p: At 2nd level, you get the ability to catch the essence of arcane power in your presence. By obtaining such energy you generate small crystalline marbles, which are shimmering inside by the cause of the caught energy. As a reaction, you get the chance to generate a marble of a spell or cantrip casted within 80 feet of you. To create such marbles, you must make a check with your spellcasting ability modifier + proficiency bonus against a DC of 10 + the base spell level casted, not the level which the spell is casted on. For cantrips the DC is 10. You can use a marble to cast the spell or cantrip within it by using your own spell slots. While doing it the marble is consumed.
You can generate one marble once during a combat using this feature.

sheet.description: As a reaction, you get the chance to generate a marble of a spell or cantrip casted within 80 feet of you. To create such marbles, you must make a check with +{{spellbinder:bindingmarbles}} against a DC of 10 + the base spell level casted, not the level which the spell is casted on. For cantrips the DC is 10. You can use a marble to cast the spell or cantrip within it by using your own spell slots. While doing it the marble is consumed.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, after you collected one or more marbles with your Binding Marbles feature you can spend time to let your book absorb the energy from it. For each marble collected you can spend 1 hours to learn the corresponding spell. While channeling the transcription you do not recognize anything of your surroundings. The transcription breaks when you or your book gets displaced or when you take damage. You can do that during a short or long rest.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you can read and understand all writings, that are not encrypted, since the symbols transform to the runic language of your mind. while reading any kind of text, your book magically takes notes of it. This includes spell scroll, spell books and any other sources too making you able to learn new spells this way with your Binding Book feature.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

At 5th level, you gain the ability to create fragile arcane crystals. While casting a spell you can decide to create a crystal holding the spell instead of releasing it right away. This crystal appears at a place you can see within the range of the chosen spell. By casting the spell that way you can declare a code word to activate it. The crystallized spell can also be activate by shattering the crystal. The place it shatters becomes the center point of the spell.

By casting a spell that needs concentration into a crystal the spell last as long as the spell provides after it’s been activated with a code word. Shattering those crystals release the spell without activating it and ends the spell if the crystal is already activated. You can only have one crystal with a spell that needs concentration using this feature. You don’t need concentration for the spell inside the crystal. You are able to cast another spell as usual with the concentration attribute during that time.

If the spell within is a single-targeted or self-targeted spell it affects the nearest possible target (read spell description which kind of target). The crystals can be destroyed without releasing the spell by using Dispel Magic on it.
To shatter a crystal it has to be hit with an attack (AC 10) or be thrown successfully (DC 13). There may be other ways to shatter them. Consult your DM to determine how.

sheet.description: While casting spells a spell you can decide to create a crystal holding the spell instead of releasing it right away. This crystal appears at a place you can see and can be used by any creature by shattering it. The place it shatters becomes the center point of the spell. By casting a spell that needs concentration into a crystal, you declare a code word to activate it. After activation it last as long as the spell provides. You don’t need concentration on the spell of the crystal. You can only have one active crystal using this feature. You are able to cast another spell as usual with the concentration attribute during that time. If the spell within is a single-targeted or self-targeted spell it affects the next possible target (read spell description which kind of target). The crystals can be destroyed without releasing the spell by using Dispel Magic on it.

description.p: When reaching 7th level, you learned how versatile the energies around you can be. When you cast a spell or cantrip, you can temporarily replace its damage type with another damage type.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell or cantrip, you can temporarily replace its damage type with another damage type.

description.p: At 10th level, you gain the ability to regenerate your powers by concentrating and meditating together with your Binding Book. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your Spellbinder level (rounded up).

sheet.description: When you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level of {{level:half:up}}.

description.p: When reaching 14th level, you finally reached a point of sensitivity to the energies around you making you feel any presence of magic. You have constantly the benefit of Detect Magic. Additionally, you gain expertise in Arcana.

sheet.description: You have constantly the benefit of Detect Magic.

description.p: At 18th level, you learned how to transform the arcane energy to an incredible amount. Once per long rest you may cast one spell of your choice without expending a spell slot or providing the material components.

sheet.description: You may cast one spell of your choice without expending a spell slot or providing the material components.

description.p: At 20th level, you became one of the most powerful Spellbinder that exist and be able to release a immense amount of arcane energy, even though you might not have all the knowledge collected as you wanted. You can transform yourself into a creature of pure energy for 1 minute. During that time, you get the following benefits:

ul.li: Whenever you cast a Spellbinder spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can cast it using your bonus action instead.
You are allowed to cast multiple spells in one turn.
All your spells and cantrips deal maximum damage or the maximum amount of healing.
You emanate an aura of energy in a 30-foot radius. All allies within that aura have advantage on saving throws using Charisma, Wisdom or Intelligence.

description.p: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
